sub_title: Assistant Professor at Erasmus MC Rotterdam
summary:
Dr. Chiarotto works as Assistant Professor at the Department of General Practice, Erasmus University Medical Center, Rotterdam.

He has a background in physiotherapy (BSc, University of Padua, Italy) and clinical epidemiology (MSc "cum laude", VU University Amsterdam, NL). In 2018, he pursued his PhD on Musculoskeletal Health at the VU University Amsterdam with a thesis entitled "A core outcome measurement set for low back pain". During the PhD, he coordinated an international group of researchers, clinicians and patient consumers to develop a core outcome measurement set for clinical trials in patients with low back pain.

Dr. Chiarotto's research currently focuses on: 1) clinical research on etiology, diagnosis, prognosis and treatment of patients with musculoskeletal disorders, primarily back and neck pain; 2) methodological research on evaluation and interpretation of patient-reported outcome measures, and on meta-research studies in rehabilitation research. He has 85 articles published in international peer-reviewed scientific journals (Google Scholar H-index: 24), including high-ranking journals like: New England Journal of Medicine, JAMA, British Medical Journal, Journal of Physiotherapy, Journal of Clinical Epidemiology, PAIN, British Journal of General Practice, Osteoarthritis and Cartilage, Journal of Orthopaedic and Sports Physical Therapy, and Annals of Physical and Rehabilitation Medicine.

He was co-supervisor of two PhD students who successfully completed their trajectory (in 2020 and 2022, Erasmus MC), and he is now daily supervisor of 8 PhD students and one post-doctoral researcher. He holds the Italian habilitation for Associate Professor in the competitive sector 06/N1 for rehabilitation sciences (scientific sector MED/48).

awards.title: Runner-up Best Abstract Award
awards.description: Second position award (out of 22 participants) for the abstract entitled “Development of a core outcome set for clinical trials in non-specific low back pain”, presented at the International and Interdisciplinary Colloquium on Research Methods in Pain Sciences, 26-27 March 2015, Brussels (Belgium)
awards.issuer: Pain Science in Motion Colloquium on Research Methods in Pain Sciences

awards.title: EMGO+ Travel Grant
awards.description: Travel grant to spend a period of two months at the Institute of Primary Care and Health Sciences of Keele University (UK) to evaluate with item response theory the Pain Attitudes and Beliefs Scale (PABS).
awards.issuer: EMGO+ Institute for Health and Care Research

awards.title: AISD Young Researchers Award
awards.description: Award received for the work entitled "Evidence of central sensitization in elderly subjects with unilateral thumb carpo-metacarpal osteoarthritis"
awards.issuer: Associazione Italiana per lo Studio del Dolore (AISD)
